question: You have decided to leave your current job even though you enjoy it.Write a letter to inform your manager of your decision. In your letter- tell the manager about your decision and the reason for it.- describe what you learnt in your current job- and ask the manager to write a reference letter to help you with future employmentDear Mr. Mathews,
text: I am writing this letter with reference to my resignation from the current role as supervisor of the Audit Team. While I enjoyed the experience of being a part of this team and learnt a range of skills, I believe there are several other challenges that I would like to explore.

I was really grateful for the opportunity to be a part of a skilled and professional team during the initial days of my career. This position has helped me acquire various crucial skills, such as time management, advanced excel, conflict management. Moreover, the current role has taught me managing people and complete the given task in an effective way whilst facing the challenges with the help of  your continuous support.
So, I would like to request you to write a reference letter with respect to my duties and responsibilities. I would really appreciate it if you could provide the letter at your earliest convenience.
Looking forward to hearing from you.
